languages.text:
"Жаждали волки младые стать поживой меньшим братьям своим,
Вышли на болтеров пир, хоть и было их мало.
Но не затем шел с ними волк старый,
Чтобы смотреть, как сожнут их нечистые косы.
Разогнал он щенков и остался один, запирающий тропы,
Ибо давно заприметил врага, что достойным казался средь недостойных.
Пели они песнь мечей громко и славно,
И встал старый волк на костях,
А затем был сражен птицами битвы".

"The young wolves yearning
to be meat for their brotherlings,
To a feast of bolters
they went out roving,
though they were but few;
One long of fang, with them
went loping,
Not to see them cut down
by scythes unclean.
The pups he sent scattering
and there stood alone,
the paths guarding;
For a foe he long spied,
One worthy among unworthy;
The song of swords singing
they clashed with clamour and skill,
Until stood the old wolf
upon the bones;
Then by the birds of battle
was he brought down."
languages.original_text:
"Жаждали волки младые стать поживой меньшим братьям своим,

Пели они песнь мечей громко и славно,
И встал старый волк на костях,
А затем был сражен птицами битвы".

traits.locale_text:
"The young wolves did hunger to become pickings for their lesser brothers,
To a feast of bolters they roved out, though they were but few,
With them went loping one long of fang,
But not to watch them be cut down by scythes unclean.
The pups he did scatter and there stood alone, blocking the paths,
For he had long spied a foe, one seeming worthy among the unworthy.
They did sing the song of swords with great clamour and skill,
Until upon the bones stood the old wolf,
But then was he brought down by the birds of battle."
traits.speaker: UlfarInPrison

languages.text:
“年轻的野狼渴望，
成为兄弟们的血肉食粮。
尽管数量寥寥，
它们加入了爆矢枪的盛宴，
恣意漫步猎场。
长着獠牙的巨狼，
与它们一同前往。
它赶走了小狼，
不愿见到它们，
在不洁的镰刀之下命丧。
它独自站在那里，
看守小路的方向。
因为它早已看到，
在乌合之众之中，
有位值得一战的悍将。
剑锋碰撞，钢铁轰响。
双方使出全部解数，你来我往，
直至老狼站在尸骨之上。
随后，凶暴的鸟群飞来，
将老狼摧垮当场。”
languages.original_text:
"The young wolves yearning
to be meat for their brotherlings,
To a feast of bolters
they went out roving,
though they were but few;
One long of fang, with them
went loping,
Not to see them cut down
by scythes unclean.
The pups he sent scattering
and there stood alone,
the paths guarding;
For a foe he long spied,
One worthy among unworthy;
The song of swords singing
they clashed with clamour and skill,
Until stood the old wolf
upon the bones;
Then by the birds of battle
was he brought down."

languages.text:
«Los jóvenes lobos ansiaban
servir de carne a sus hermanos,
y a un festín de bólters
marcharon bien ufanos.
Eran pocos pero lozanos;
uno de ellos, más viejo,
se unió en esta hazaña
para evitar que cayeran
a manos de impías guadañas.
Dispersó a los cachorros
y resistió con valentía,
impidiendo que otros siguieran esa vía.
Pues había visto a su enemigo,
uno digno entre la escoria;
el clamor de sus espadas,
magistral, trajo la gloria,
hasta que el viejo lobo
de su rival solo dejó la memoria;
y de los pájaros de la guerra
entonces cayó presa».
languages.original_text:
"The young wolves yearning
to be meat for their brotherlings,
To a feast of bolters
they went out roving,
though they were but few;
One long of fang, with them
went loping,
Not to see them cut down
by scythes unclean.
The pups he sent scattering
and there stood alone,
the paths guarding;
For a foe he long spied,
One worthy among unworthy;
The song of swords singing
they clashed with clamour and skill,
Until stood the old wolf
upon the bones;
Then by the birds of battle
was he brought down."

languages.text:
「若い狼たちは
兄弟の肉となることを切望した
ボルターの宴のため
わずかな人数で
放浪の旅に出た
長い牙を持つ一匹が
彼らと一緒に駈けて行き
穢れた鎌で刈り取られるのを
目撃した。
仔犬たちは散り散りになり
一匹で孤独に立ちながら
道を守っていた
彼はもっともふさわしい協定を
長い間、敵を見張っていた
剣の歌が歌い
けたたましく巧みにぶつかり合い
老いた狼が
骨の上に立った
そして戦いの鳥たちによって
彼は倒された」
languages.original_text:
"The young wolves yearning
to be meat for their brotherlings,
To a feast of bolters
they went out roving,
though they were but few;
One long of fang, with them
went loping,
Not to see them cut down
by scythes unclean.
The pups he sent scattering
and there stood alone,
the paths guarding;
For a foe he long spied,
One worthy among unworthy;
The song of swords singing
they clashed with clamour and skill,
Until stood the old wolf
upon the bones;
Then by the birds of battle
was he brought down."

languages.text:
"Die jungen Wölfe, sich sehnend danach,
Fleisch für ihre Brüderlinge zu sein,
ein Festmahl für Bolter,
sie streunten aus,
doch waren es nur wenige.
Einer mit Zähnen lang
zog mit ihnen aus,
um nicht sie von schmutz'gen
Sensen niedergestreckt zu sehen.
Die Jungen stieb er auseinander,
allein stand er dann dort,
die Pfade bewachend.
Denn einen Feind er hatte erblickt,
einen Würdigen unter Unwürdigen.
Das Lied der Schwerter ertönte,
sang lärmend vom Können,
bis der alte Wolf allein
auf den Knochen stand.
Dann zwangen die Vögel der Schlacht
ihn in die Knie."
languages.original_text:
"The young wolves yearning

languages.text:
« Les jeunes loups mourant d'envie
de pouvoir nourrir leurs frères
partirent au-devant des ennuis
au milieu des bolters,
bien qu'en nombre réduit.
L'un d'entre eux aux dents longues
prit la fuite ventre à terre,
échappant à la mort d'une seconde
sous des faux sanguinaires.
Il dispersa les petits
et resta là, solitaire,
protégeant les chemins investis,
le regard fixé sur un adversaire
plus digne que les autres, décatis.
Sous le fracas des lames et des coups,
ils se battirent avec ardeur et talent,
jusqu'à ce que seul le vieux loup
subsiste sur les ossements.
Puis les oiseaux de combat, prêts à tout,
l'abattirent sans ménagement. »
languages.original_text:
"The young wolves yearning
to be meat for their brotherlings,
To a feast of bolters
they went out roving,
though they were but few;
One long of fang, with them
went loping,
Not to see them cut down
by scythes unclean.
The pups he sent scattering
and there stood alone,
the paths guarding;
For a foe he long spied,
One worthy among unworthy;
The song of swords singing
they clashed with clamour and skill,
Until stood the old wolf
upon the bones;
Then by the birds of battle
was he brought down."

languages.text:
"Yavru kurtlar arzular
Kardeşlerinin açlığını dindirmeyi,
Bulonatarların ziyafetine doğru
Çıkmışlar gezintiye
Bir avuç kalsalar da.
Uzun bir diş, sıçrayıp durur
Onlarla birlikte,
Arınmamış tırpanlarla
Kesilip biçilmesinler diye.
Dağılmış gönderdiği yavrular;
Orada tek başlarına bekler,
Yolları korurlar.
Çünkü çoktandır göz diktiği düşman,
Aşağılıkların arasında layık durur.
Feryat ve yetenekle çarpışan
Kılıçların şarkısı söylenir,
Ta ki yaşlı kurt
Kemiklerin üstünde dikilene dek.
Ardından çatışmanın kuşları
Onu yere indirir."
languages.original_text:
"The young wolves yearning
to be meat for their brotherlings,

they went out roving,
though they were but few;
One long of fang, with them
went loping,
